text: arriving to great fanfare the smooth and
controlled touchdown bringing an end to
what's been a remarkable and
record-breaking journey Solar Impulse 2
is the brainchild of Bertrand Piccard he
was piloting the plane for the final
time everything is possible
why don't we dream more why don't we try
more and when I touched my wills here I
thought ok it's a start the aircraft has
the wingspan of a jumbo jet but the
weight of a family car using the sun's
rays is powered by 17,000 solar cells
peppered all over the wings which drive
for electric motors its mission to
promote renewable energy the aircraft
set off from Abu Dhabi on the 9th of
March last year heading for the Persian
Gulf that across India China America
and lastly Europe before returning to
the Emirates this morning the fifth leg
of its journey from Burma to China was
deemed to be one of the trickiest by the
pilot and his compatriot Andre
Borschberg because of the mountainous
terrain today it's the flight to China
Chongqing if everything goes well all
day will continue tomorrow morning with
Solar Impulse to bring it to Nanjing for
the team behind is Wonder plane a chance
now to reflect and consider that maybe
one day in the not so distant future
passenger planes could become a lot
greener and cleaner a me cold
